text: The Big West Men's Soccer Tournament is the conference championship tournament in soccer for the Big West Conference. The tournament has been held every year since 2008. It is a single-elimination tournament and seeding is based on regular season records. The winner, declared conference champion, receives the conference's automatic bid to the NCAA Men's Division I Soccer Championship. ==Champions== === Key === {| class="wikitable" |- | (2) | Title number |- |style="background-color:#FBCEB1"|* |Match went to extra time |- |style="background-color:#cedff2"|† |Match decided by a penalty shootout after extra time |- |Bold |Winning team won regular season |} ===Finals=== {| class="wikitable sortable" !Year !Champion !Score !Runner-up !Site !Most Valuable Player |- |2008 |UC Irvine |align=center|4–2 |UC Santa Barbara |Anteater Stadium • Irvine, CA | Andrew Fontein, UC Irvine |- |2009 |UC Irvine |align=center|4–1 |UC Santa Barbara |Anteater Stadium • Irvine, CA | Carlos Aguilar, UC Irvine |- |2010 |UC Santa Barbara |align=center|3–1 |Cal State Fullerton |Harder Stadium • Santa Barbara, CA | Luis Silva, UCSB |- |2011 |UC Irvine |align=center style="background-color:#FBCEB1"|3–2* |UC Santa Barbara |Anteater Stadium • Irvine, CA | Miguel Ibarra, UC Irvine |- |2012 |Cal State Northridge |align=center|1–0 |UC Davis |Aggie Field • Davis, CA | Sagi Lev- Ari, CSUN |- |2013 |UC Irvine |align=center|1–0 |Cal State Northridge |Anteater Stadium • Irvine, CA | Enrique Cardenas, UC Irvine |- |2014 |Cal State Fullerton |align=center style="background-color:#cedff2"|0–0† |UC Irvine |Anteater Stadium • Irvine, CA | Jeff Salt, CSU Fullerton |- |2015 |Cal State Fullerton |align=center|1–0 |UC Santa Barbara |Harder Stadium • Santa Barbara, CA | David Rodriguez Elias, CSU Fullerton |- |2016 |Cal State Northridge |align=center style="background-color:#FBCEB1"|2–1* |Cal State Fullerton |Matador Soccer Field • Northridge, CA | Kevin Marquez, CSUN |- |2017 | Cal State Fullerton (3) |align=center style="background- color:#cedff2"| 0–0 † (4–3 pk) | UC Davis | Aggie Field • Davis, CA | Paul-Andre Guerin, UC Davis |} ==Performance by school== === Most championships === {| class="wikitable" !
